Hello blank fragment
The lion (Panthera leo) is one of the big cats in the genus Panthera and a member of the family Felidae
Gorillas are ground-dwelling, predominantly herbivorous apes that inhabit the forests of central Africa.
The tiger (Panthera tigris) is the largest cat species.
The giraffe (Giraffa) is a genus of African even-toed ungulate mammals.
Foxes are small-to-medium-sized, omnivorous mammals belonging to several genera of the family Canidae.
Armadillos are New World placental mammals with a leathery armour shell.
The domestic dog (Canis lupus familiaris or Canis familiaris) is a member of genus Canis.
Penguins (order Sphenisciformes, family Spheniscidae) are a group of aquatic, flightless birds.
Eagles are large, powerfully built birds of prey, with heavy heads and beaks.
Rabbits are small mammals in the family Leporidae of the order Lagomorpha, found in several parts of the world.
Dolphins are a widely distributed and diverse group of aquatic mammals.
Snakes are elongated, legless, carnivorous reptiles of the suborder Serpentes[2].
Pinnipeds belong to the order Carnivora and their closest living relatives are bears and musteloids (weasels, raccoons, skunks and red pandas), having diverged about 50 million years ago.
A rhinoceros (/raɪˈnɒsərəs/, meaning "nose horn"), often abbreviated to rhino.
The leopard (Panthera pardus) /ˈlɛpərd/ is one of the five "big cats" in the genus Panthera.
The common hippopotamus (Hippopotamus amphibius), or hippo, is a large, mostly herbivorous mammal in sub-Saharan Africa.
A pig is any of the animals in the genus Sus, within the Suidae family of even-toed ungulates.
Starfish or sea stars are star-shaped echinoderms belonging to the class Asteroidea.
Owls are birds from the order Strigiformes.
